Ratings.comment: Great larning experience! Really recommend his class!
One of the best
Hi is one of the best professors period.

Avoid this class as an ISE technical elective unless you have a background in and are very interested in electricity. Terrible, boring, and unclear lecturer. You will learn more from the book than from lectures. Homework assignments take a very long time to do and required multiple tries. Exams are easy if you know the material relatively well.

Only has a few homework assignments in the class, but each takes a LONG time. One assignment took a group of five of us over 12 hours to do. Only one midterm, few homeworks, and the final, so each grade matters quite a bit. Clear exams though, just make sure you prepare for them in advance. Just cause they're open notes doesn't mean they're easy.
Great larning experience! Really recommend his class!
One of the best
Hi is one of the best professors period.

Avoid this class as an ISE technical elective unless you have a background in and are very interested in electricity. Terrible, boring, and unclear lecturer. You will learn more from the book than from lectures. Homework assignments take a very long time to do and required multiple tries. Exams are easy if you know the material relatively well.

Only has a few homework assignments in the class, but each takes a LONG time. One assignment took a group of five of us over 12 hours to do. Only one midterm, few homeworks, and the final, so each grade matters quite a bit. Clear exams though, just make sure you prepare for them in advance. Just cause they're open notes doesn't mean they're easy.

Professor Groeber was my favorite teacher this semester. The 8 am classes were hard to get up for but he made it worth it. He has excellent examples that are relatable. The labs are interesting and hands-on. Many lab reports but it really solidifies the material for the exams. Office hours definitely worth going to!
The goat. Top 5 lecturer I've had at OSU. Exams a little more difficult than you would expect but not bad at all. Pretty funny
There cannot possibly be a better professor to teach this class, at least I cannot imagine one. Just an amazing professor. I would list specifics but there is a word limit.
2500 was fairly difficult, but Prof Groeber made the 8ams worth going to. He is incredibly knowledgeable and is always available for help. The exams were not easy and you will need to study.

ISE 2400 was only offered in the evening but Todd made it worthwhile. Participating in the in-class activities almost always ensured a good grade in the exams. Todd is caring, patient, and entertaining, not to mention passionate about teaching. His real-life experiences translate well into a learning setting and the group projects are insightful.

Todd is a very solid, funny professor. The content, to me, was actually really interesting, though I don't know if that is the general consensus. The course is pretty easy, but the two midterms and the finals were always a decent bit harder than the lectures and quizzes would make you think they'd be.

Professor Schneider was the perfect professor for this class. Very funny guy who enjoys what he teaches. The only downsides are the course time slot and how many assignments there are. He described the course as "a 4 credit hour class for 7 weeks" as opposed to a 2 credit hour course for 7 weeks. The work wasn't difficult, but there was a lot.

The material of this class can be very difficult, at least to me. I thought Sam was a very passionate professor and really cared about the material he was teaching. Overall I found his lectures helpful and I think he is a good professor. He doesn't respond to emails unfortunately though so you're forced to go to office hours.

Sam is helpful but slow to respond to emails. You need to attend class since he doesn't provide slides with notes, and his handwriting is hard to read. Assignments are time-consuming. The course focuses on problem-solving, requiring both patience and attention to detail. Fortunately, exams are straightforward, based on homework and slides.
Homeworks are very tough, lectures are not very helpful, exams are ok if you make sure if spend enough time on homeworks. Unfortunately this is the only section so you cant avoid him

Can't avoid his class due to only one section and offered only on SP. Very generous grader doesn't mean that you learn a great deal. Homework take your energy and time significantly so be prepared. As long as you get above 90/100 for all your HW, you are guaranteed to get above B.
Difficult subject with difficult homework and tests. Fair grader (especially considering difficulty of coursework), and extremely interesting material
Can be difficult content and his lecturing skills are average on best. Homework and exams are also difficult but he is good one on one and gives you time on your assignments

hes not great at explaining things in lectures, i had a hard time knowing what was going on. the homework is hard and the exams are hard but hes a very generous grader so it makes up for it. overall not a bad choice, just hard to follow along.

Sam was awesome. Really really nice dude. Had him in his first semester at OSU. He was always ready to answer questions in or outside of class. He made each student write a short paper about themselves and bring it to his office hours so he could meet each student. Overall really cool dude and good teacher, would recommend.

3200 with Prof. Chen was extremely straightforward. 6 homeworks, and 2 midterms. While attendance isn't mandatory, simply showing up and paying attention would be sufficient to easily get a passing grade in the course. While the content may be dry, Chen explains it very clearly and adds his own touch of humor to it. Highly recommend!

His late day policy for homework was really generous, and helped out a ton throughout the semester, as well as recorded lectures. Class was a positive experience, and tied right into the homework and exams.
Great guy, cares about teaching. Does not like when people come to his office hours.

I really enjoyed 3200 with Chen... easy class, straightforward, very knowledgeable, and intelligent professor. He taught a lot of material. I see what people mean about office hours though. Still, take him!

Chen's lectures are very hard to follow but at least his exams are open note. Using the notes makes the tests easier but I don't think he's very clear during class. He uses paper, pen, and WHITE OUT to erase his mistakes. Like just use a pencil. Or an ipad.

I was nervous about this class because I read previous reviews. Chen's class was honestly a pretty good experience for me (and I assume my classmates as well). I found his lectures pretty interesting. He goes off on "tangents" that are real life and relatable to what we're learning. I have 0 complaints about him tbh.
You are going to have to teach yourself all of the material

Very difficult to follow lectures as they are very theoretical, you'll then be hit with homework and test question that you've never seen and don't know how to answer. Very condescending in office if you don't understand something.

Chen is all over the place. Doesn't explain things clearly and his handwriting is illegible so going back in the notes is a lost cause. To top it off he is incredibly unfriendly and demeaning if you dare to try to get extra help in office hours.

I really enjoy my major and liked this class, but he kind of ruined for me this past Spring. You can't ask him any questions otherwise he gets offended that you aren't a PhD expert in the subject the minute you walk into the door. I'm sure there are other professors who do a better job at being a professor out there.

The class itself was interesting, but he is a terrible teacher. He makes you feel really stupid if you ask any questions relating to the class, and its basically pointless to go to him for help. I would advise taking other professors and Im ashamed Ohio state would hire him to be a professor.

Going to class is basically the same as not going to class. Material isn't that hard but you have to teach yourself literally everything. If you have specific questions office hours can be helpful but good luck figuring out what questions to ask

Extremely knowledgeable, but can't teach. His in-class slides aren't impossible to understand, but it takes so much time outside of class to understand them, so going to class useless. Just be aware that you are not getting the easiest, nor are you getting the best 3200 professors by taking him. Avoid if you can, you'll still pass regardless.

Favorite professor at Ohio State. Class is so fun, professor is clear with what he wants. Not hard to pass the class at all. It is very hands on and he helps you along the way; as long as you're learning.
Tracy is the best professor I have met at OSU, I look forward to taking more classes with him.

Tracy Owens is easily the best professor at Ohio State. Just learning from him is worth the extra work of the L&SS capstone program. He cares about each student individually, will match the effort you put in, and goes above & beyond to apply any feedback he is given! I can't speak highly enough of him.
straightforward lectures, great teaching methods, highly recommend.
Dr.Owens is a great professor. He ensures that all the questions that a student has get answered.

If you can take this course with Professor Owens, do yourself the favor and do it! Tracy balances being hands-off while also walking with you through this course well. He trusted my group's judgment on decisions, but was always willing to help if need be. The experience gained through this course is priceless. Easy choice to get your green belt!
This guy puts the ISE department on his back IMO

Best professor I've had at OSU! Can definitely tell how much he cares about Six Sigma and genuinely wants to help each student pass the Green Belt certification class. Definitely have to put in the work outside of class and pay attention during, but it is so worth it

Dr. Castro is the most caring professor I've ever had. He wants each student to succeed and gain useful knowledge and skills from the class. He is very accommodating and flexible, and he practically tells you what will be on the exams. His lectures can be boring, but if you go to class, participate, and get to know him it's one of the best.
I couldn't understand Professor Castro when he was using his mask and holding a mic up to his face didn't help. Boring lectures but easy class, made it clear what was on the exam.

Great professor, the class I took with him was very easy. The material itself wasn't complicated and he took the time to make sure we understood stuff. His 'quizzes' were group quizzes, and we just answered questions as a class, so it was super easy. The homework and tests were very easy, he practically tells you what exactly is going to be on it.
Pretty interesting class and Dr. Castro is cool and makes it easy. Definitely recommend as a tech elective

AWESOME TEACHER! Best teacher I have ever had. I was so blessed to have him as a teacher. I learned a lot from him. He is very helpful and a very nice guy. He is always willing to help you.His lectures are very interesting and he has a great sense of humor. I enjoyed so much being in his class I wish I could take more classes with him. Gracias Dr.C
Good professore!!
Can't even understand what he's saying. lecture was never required so i never went. just do the hw and make a good cheat sheet for the exams.
Horrible person.  Least helpful professor I've ever met.
Typical undergrad class for undergrad students. Go to class, and he tells you what's going to be on the test. The material is mathematically involved but his expectations are pretty low.

Castro: English was bad, kind of boring.  ISE311: Easy, informative class, but completely unorgainzed material wise (see comments following).  Book: proof that people with ADD can succeed in society, or at least get their book published.
interesting class
No Comments

The class is quite easy.  Its an easy A if you put forth a little effort.  The organization of the class is a little confusing but if you study the day before your exams for a few hours and make a good cheat sheet you will ace the class.

The only reason for going to this class is so you can sign the attendence sheet which is 10% of your grade.  After that go back to bed.  Bonus: He apologizes the 1st day for having poor English skills.

This class is probably the most worthless class I've had to take. If you can make good equation sheets and be able to plug in numbers on an exam, you will get an A. Castro is an ok guy, I just feel sorry that the class he teaches sucks!

If you take this class with Castro I hope you like looking at "pieceths" from a "corbette," because you'll be seeing them on a daily basis.  Occasionally he'll pull out a part from a "hunda" for a change of pace.
No Comments
good teacher

My friend and I had a translation dictionary of  60+ "words" that he said and what he actually meant by those words.  Very hard to understand.  Knows subject very well, just cant communicate it very clearly.

All of the difficulty in Castro's class arises out of the appalling disorganization of the course material rather than from any inherent difficulty of said material, which consists primarily of plugging numbers into stupid equations.
I learned alot about MACHEEENING.  No, I guess I didn't really, but I like saying MACHEEENING now.

Dr.Ramteen is a tough professor. He treats the class like a weed out course. It is almost impossible to get an A in this class. He does not do many example problems and always makes sure that any example he shows in class is not fully finished. He expects the students to know certain concepts which are not very easy to understand.

Ramteen is a good guy at heart, it just takes some time and effort to figure that out and get to know him. Office hours were really helpful, but it's unfortunate that office hours were one of the only places to get practice problem answers. If you put in work and try your best, you'll get a lot out of the class!
Not a great professor, doesn't help you for exams, and comes off as rude

I was pretty nervous going into this class after hearing all the horror stories but Ramteen did a great job to dispel those myths. Yes it is a difficult class at times, but if you read the book, do the extra practice he gives, and make an effort to go to office hours and tutorials the class is very reasonable. He grades fairly and is always helpful

Lectures are clear and fantastic. However, that's not gonna help you pass the exam. You need to read the textbook. All his homework relates a little to exams. He never gives partial credits. I recommend finding passed students to help you with homework instead of his office hour, it's wasting time! Remeber to give him a bad rating in the end!

He can be intense and intimidating, but if you understand what he expects of you then he will be very helpful. Do NOT ask if you are doing something right, he may or may not lecture you on why he's not going to do that, and it's not pleasant if he does (I would know). If you ask genuine questions, pay attention, do the work, you will at least pass.

You have no choice, you still have to take ISE 3210 with him if you are an ISE major. Just to let you know how tough he's grading is. The current average is C in the class. There used to be 70 student in his class, and only around 20 of students at the end of semester. He's generous now, but still get an average C in this class.

Ramteen is cut and dry on grades. This is a math class so there is a right answer and he won't just give it to you. That being said (with the exception of some "general math topics"), he tests what he teaches and he teaches it well. He has a bad rep but has an awesome dry humor and is very helpful. Treat him like a human; he is pretty cool.

You will learn a ton in this class. He is a scary dude in class--try not to be afraid of him because I really don't think he's actually a bad person. He randomly calls on people in class, so always be prepared. READ THE BOOK. REVIEW THE MATH CONCEPTS LIST AT THE BEGINNING OF THE SEMESTER. DO ASSIGNED PRACTICE PROBLEMS. Don't cheat on homework!!!
Awesome teacher. Very clear and precise in lectures. Also really cares about the students. The content can be a little tough but he's always willing to help.

Ramteen pretty much is the worst at setting you up for success. He's really unhelpful and unless you know someone who has all the answers from the previous classes, you're screwed. Even if you go to office hours he won't tell you if you're right or wrong. OH, and theres a midterm worth 20% of your grade the first week, so watch out for that.
Dont take this class!

Ramteen can be really intimidating but if you go to him for help and get over that he is really really helpful. If you want to do well in his class, go to office hours and get help the moment you think you might be behind
The course was pretty easy but the content is extremely dry and was nearly impossible to take at 8 in the morning. Was hard to stay awake through the lectures.
Great professor! Really cares about her students, and even though some of the assignments took a lot of time, she was always available to help explain things clearly. Would definitely recommend!

Guzin is hands down one of the best professors I have had at OSU within the ISE department. She is extremely caring for her students. She is also a fantastic professor; making difficult and complex topics easy to understand and giving ample practice to apply the material and do well on exams. Highly recommend her and all her classes!

The overall experience is the best I've had at OSU engineering school. The class is a good balance between theory and practicality. Her lectures are amazing and the subject is her expertise. The assignments are challenging but definitely worth spending time on.

She is excited about teaching and obviously loves this subject. She is an effective lecturer, and I truly learned a lot from her. Quiz questions, especially on take home quizzes, can be extremely difficult. I don't think that she realizes this until students give her feedback. Assignments are graded hard. She does not give much help in office hours

Probably one of the toughest graders in ISE (after Ramteen & Sink), still pretty solid choice for a lecturer as she knows how to lecture. The labs in this class are the worst organized labs I have ever seen. This class needs a whole curricular overhaul, but Guzin is a decent teacher at that.

This is her research field, which means this is her expertise. She explains things in great detail. We do a little of everything, modeling, proofs and computation. The drawback is we don't have enough time to go through some topics. However, you will be able to learn advanced topics and read relevant research paper  by your own after this class.

Dr. Krening is a spectacular teacher, and maybe it was because the classes were online and it was the lockdown, but I was entranced by her voice. She is so brilliant, she knows what she's talking about, and she has lived it. its such an an exceptional opportunity to learn from her. I hope to get the chance to meet her in person when COVID ends.
